text: [Music]
Technology has transformed our lives.
It's transformed the lives uh of
ourselves, our parents, our kids in ways
that most people take for granted. It's
improved our ability to communicate
where I can get on Skype and talk to my
folks and they can see my my kids.
Literally, we're feel connected like
never before. It's made it so that we
can live longer, healthier lives and on
demand I can go and get a slew of
medical data to know what's wrong and
find the best doctors in the planet to
come in and help me. That's
extraordinary and that brings us to a
world ultimately of safety where I can I
can have access to to know how I am
physically. I can know monetarily uh how
I am. I can be in touch with anywhere on
the planet at any time I need. It's
emotional safety and physical safety.
So, we're living in a day and age where
we here in the developed world, you
know, the person who literally gets
online, you know, is able to get any
information they want any time of the
day or night, order and buy whatever
they want any time of the day or night.
We're living as emperors and kings would
have lived a hundred years ago and we
take it for granted. It is transforming
our world in a way uh that is making us
uh godlike in many ways.
